cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.DB. 

The paper discusses a method for formalizing scientific claims using a controlled natural language, which has applications in various fields such as natural language processing, artificial intelligence, and information retrieval. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of semantic search and knowledge graphs, which are relevant to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses consistency checking and fact checking, which are relevant to cs.DB (Databases). Finally, the paper mentions the use of publications, which is relevant to cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
